::Kluster/Grimmler/Fliq/Firearm/Prowl::

Kluster dives to the side, feeling his body shaking from the waves, 
but he was otherwise unhurt. He rolls to his feet, a heavy-fire rifle 
in his hands instead of his missile launcher as he comes up and fires 
three shots back at Reflector.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
"We're reentering the atmosphere," Grimmler says as he checks the 
scanners, "There's a battle near the CF, as we already know."

His eyes narrow as an idea occurrs to him. A smile slowly creeps onto 
his lips.

"Ok, Fliq, buckle up and don't hold on to anything," he says after 
relaying his plan to Fliq, "This is gonna be a ride from the Pit."
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Firearm frowns, looking back at Prowl. He knew there was a battle at 
the CF, and he knew that the Maximals might need some help.

"Prowl, can't this wait?" he asks over the comm, "We might be needed 
at the CF."

He watches Prowl turn around and hears the owl-bot's voice replying 
affirmatively over the comm. Prowl's jetpack activates and quickly 
brings him level with Firearm.

"Let's go," Prowl says, both of them heading for the CF at top speed.




--- In nbwrpg@y..., KSLawdogg@c... wrote:
> (I haven't gotten around to posting the revised profiles of the new 
bodies of 
> the three Brotherhood members below, but anyone who fought them at 
the CF 
> prior to this battle, you should notice Sun Crusher and Reflector 
are a 
> couple feet taller and all of them look a lot meaner
> 
> Also, someone post damage for the base.  If not Firefox, then 
please IR since 
> she be in command)
> 
> Vehement/Sun Crusher/Reflector:
> 
> 
> 
> Vehement watched the few Maximals gathering  together.  Like 
insects.  About 
> to be crushed under Vehement's foot.  But suddenly Vehement felt 
sick and he 
> hurt all over has his optics unvoluntarily focused in on Hot Rod.
> 
> The blood colored optic sensors turned to a light emerald almost 
immediately 
> and Vehement knew he was no longer under control of his own body, 
though he 
> could watch from his optics and feel his limbs and everything else 
move, but 
> he couldn't control, almost like a dream.  He knew it was divine 
intervention.
> 
> "You," Vehement heard his own body say in a voice like his only a 
tad bit 
> deeper as a finger pointed at Hot Rod, "will fight me now.  And 
die."
> 
> An eight foot long broadsword appeared in Vehement's right hand, 
and he could 
> feel his hand close around it tightly as rage that wasn't his began 
boiling.
> 
> ---
> 
> Sun Crusher watched an enemy fire upon Reflector but turned back to 
Iron 
> Raptor.  He could feel something inside of her.  Something of 
power.  Though 
> Vehement had been taken over, Sun Crusher could feel a voice in his 
mind.
> 
> < /BRING IT TO ME/ >, < /DO NOT FAIL, FOR THAT WHICH I GIVE CAN BE 
TAKEN 
> AWAY, DIPLOMACY OR FORCE, NONE MATTER, SIMPLY GET IT/>
> 
> The voice hurt, but not as much as it had in his weaker body.  He 
looked to 
> Iron Raptor's chest with a glare.  He had to get whatever it was 
that was 
> beneath it.  His master knew, but the servant didn't.
> 
> "You." he said, moving his glare to Iron Raptor's optics.  "You 
will give me 
> what is in your chest.  The source of power.  The..."
> 
> < /THE MATRIX/ > the voice roared in his head, causing more pain.
> 
> "Give me the Matrix, heathen scum, and we will leave for good and 
never 
> return to this unholy place.  On our word as servants of the Chaos-
Bringer.  
> If not, your bodies will rest at our feet battered and broken 
beyond 
> recognition and restoration.  The choice for you is the easy path, 
or the 
> difficult path.  But you heathens lack hope and intensity.  Thou 
shalt not 
> win unless you give us what we want."
> 
> ---
> 
> Reflector had been busy, but he still seen Kluster come out of the 
battered 
> base with a weapon of war.
> 
> "Heathen fool." he muttered under his breath, firing off a single 
bolt of 
> optic energy at one missile, the other one impact with his chest 
plate.  He 
> flipped back through the air a few feet, straightening out though.  
In his 
> old body he thought, he'd have drawn mech-fluid like a pathetic 
heathen.  But 
> now he was strong.  Sadly, the weakest of his cadre.
> 
> His despair had been replaced with a deep unfathomles emotion that 
seemed to 
> be hate and a hunger for destruction, death, and total chaos.
> 
> He raised a wrist mounted with twin barrels, a barrage of sonic 
waves 
> launching out at Kluster's midsection.
